titles.title: Citizen Involvement in Campaigns Act of 2005
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide a credit and a deduction for small political contributions.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.summary: 2/17/2005--Introduced. Citizen Involvement in Campaigns Act of 2005 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow: (1) a $200 tax credit ($400 for joint returns) for contributions to a candidate for Federal elective public office or to the national committee of a national political party; and (2) a tax deduction (available to taxpayers who do not itemize deductions) for such political contributions up to $600 ($1,200 for joint returns).
